channel.title: Comments on: Managing threads with Queue and SizedQueue
channel.description: Red Panthers - Experts in Ruby on Rails, System Design and Vue.js

item.title: By: Harisankar P S
item.dc:creator: Harisankar P S
item.description: Thanks for the comment, it's always good to use the mature open source libraries for production. But it's always good to learn how to roll in your own. Incase you want to go minimalistic. Thanks again for the comment.
item.content:encoded:
Thanks for the comment, it’s always good to use the mature open source libraries for production.
But it’s always good to learn how to roll in your own. Incase you want to go minimalistic.
Thanks again for the comment.

item.title: By: NIMMY J VIPIN
item.dc:creator: NIMMY J VIPIN
item.description: Thanks for the comment. Will update it soon.
item.content:encoded: Thanks for the comment. Will update it soon.

item.title: By: nil2
item.dc:creator: nil2
item.description: Please consider using ruby-concurrent and the classes it has (including a thread pool class, ThreadPoolExecutor), instead of rolling your own.
item.content:encoded: Please consider using ruby-concurrent and the classes it has (including a thread pool class, ThreadPoolExecutor), instead of rolling your own.
